Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: johiley
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've ever been as impressed with a hotel as I was with this one. The location is ideal, in easy walking distance of the main historical attractions as well as the waterfront. As a young, solo traveller I especially appreciated the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Considering the incredibly low price, the facilities were really outstanding: rooms were spotless, comfortable and tastefully decorated, and the buffet breakfast was very good with lots of choice. I very much hope to return in future!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mia1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct 2011 for 4 days. Its a great little hotel. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Room was perfect and clean. The hotel is in a great location for exploring Istanbul. There are lots of good bars and restaurants near the hotel also. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: I regularly travel through Istanbul and stay at the Agan. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are always clean. The Hotel Agan was a great find for me. It represents the best value for money that I have ever found.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TripLuca78
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful 5-day vacation at the Agan in Instanbul - not only it is located in the very hearth of the old wonderful city but the staff of the hotel was so friendly! We also had some delicious food / taps out on the veranda to chill out and everything was so delicious, including the "Shisha" or "NargilÃ¨" :-) The staff was also so helpful, they were giving us tips, directions, etc... All the major attractions of the city are nearby, just few minutes walking distance... :-) if I'll ever go back to Instanbul again (I wish!) I'd definitely stay again at the Again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lcoso
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel Agan for 4 days. First day we arrived but couldn't get into our room since they had some problems with electricity. We were sent to hotel 30 metars away for the night. In the morning we were back and got our room. Room was small but very clean with relatively new furniture. Complaints about room size are pretty crazy. In London and Paris rooms are smaller and much more expencive. Location is great! Few minutes from Gulhane tram station which is very convenient if you are using public transportation but most important Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque are just few hundred metars away. Staff are polite and very helpfull, honestly in istanbul i didn't met anyone rude. Restaurant in the hotel is OK, ideal for a break between two rounds of wandering through istanbul. Problem could be a noise from street and restauran but after hours of walking we were sleaping like a babies. It is possible to arange transportation from and to both istanbul Airports which I did and was percect (Thank You Ayca), also there are shuttle buses. If You are on budget and arriving on Ataturk than public transportation from airport to Gulhane tram station is the best and cheapest option. If you are going early to airport then use a shuttle bus. Yes there is policy about food and drinks in room... but honestly after wandering around we were coming back bringing water and baklavas and no one made a comentary on that. Would I recommend this hotel? Yes I would. Would I be coming back? Of course.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL IN TURKEY”
Reviews.Author: turgut m
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms rude staff low quality food and awfully dirty tables and chairs outside problem with heating system and cooling also compulsory tours they even will not let you to take a bottle of water to your room

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Agan the first day we landed in istanbul after the long flight from home. It is located on a fun/funky side street very near the Gulhane tram stop. It's walking distance to all the Old Town sights. We got to check in early, which was great, and bleary eyed, cleaned up and tried to get a few hours of sleep before heading out. It was not to be, because there was bang-banging all around our room, and then a request for us to leave the room so they could bang in there for a while. - Great location - Good value in the off-season, in this case March - The breakfast area is cramped and was over flowing with too many people when we went down for breakfast. Try early. - Lots of loud street noise, people not traffic, if your window is open. - The interior walls are paper thin, you will hear everything going on in the next room - Typical European size rooms and bathroom, very clean. - The hallways smelled strongly of cigarettes.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Arch5
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agan offers everything you need for a memorable stay in Istanbul. Excellent location and friendly, helpful staff who are always willing to provide suggestions about sightseeing tours and local hotspots. The boys on reception, Turgut and Murat, were particularly helpful in this respect! All in all, a great choice of hotel. I'd happily stay here again. :-)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay @ the agan!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laura752
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic stay in instanbul at the agan hotel.. I would highly recommend this hotel.... It is within easy walking distance to all local attractions,the port and tram.The staff are all very helpful at the hotel especially turgut on reception,nothing was a probelm for our many requests..The food was also nice and the rooms clean... We will definately be returning...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with all conveniences.”
Reviews.Author: anchi100
Reviews.Content: I booked Agan hotel based on good reviews and the good price they offered (it is off-season in February, so in my view the price-quality ratio was excellent). The hotel met my expectations. It is a small and convenient hotel with friendly atmosphere. I would gladly stay here again in the future. The location - very easy to find, just few meters away from Gulhane tram stop; easy to reach all sites in Sultanahmet on foot, as well as Sirkeci/Eminonu transport hub. The room was ok in size (for one person it even felt spacious), everything looked modern and clean. All appliances worked well and there was a strong wi fi signal. The bathroom was small but quite enough for me. Reception staff was friendly, cheerful and tried to do their best. The breakfast was very good for such small hotel: big variety of food, cold and some hot dishes, everything was very tasty. Overall: another excellent stay in Istanbul :).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay at Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HAMID R
Reviews.Content: I stayed 10 days in cold season at Agan hotel.The room price is reasonable, atmosphere is lovely and you feel at home.The staff especially receptionists are so kind and cooperative.Although the room was small but suit,Bathroom,shower room, Bed and ...was very clean.Wifi was available too.Breakfast with fresh fruits was very good also.The hotel place is excellent and is close to anciant mosques, attractive buildings,traditional restaurants and taxi , tram ,ship stations by walking.The only negative point was TV programs on turkish language and I couldn't find any chanell in english.I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Sabina K
Reviews.Content: This place is great value for money and more.. the rooms are clean and the bathrooms are clean. The staff are really friendly and available 24 7, close to all the local attractions, the blue mosque etc. The metro is down the road so you can catch it to go anywhere. I will definately be staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice wintertime at AGAN”
Reviews.Author: Olga084
Reviews.Content: Well, just yesterday i am coming back to Minsk from Istanbul. I got vacation(18 days) until students of our university get wintervacations too. Some first days(24-26 of January) weather was very good anmd warm ai Istanbul. But later "siberian frost" was coming and i saw "Beyaz Istanbul"("White Istanbul").A lot of snow,ice on roads and pavements,winndy...But anyway it was great! Istanbul is great and perfect in any weather! As everytime i was stayed at AGAN, at my "second home". I got small but very warm and clear room with comfortable bed and TVset.Breakfast was also very nice(let me say, that breakfast is very good at AGAN everytime!).So after breakfast i could walk around this snowy Istanbul til afternoon. And if i wanted drink hot tea or eat something, i could do that in any of small and big cafe around Sirkeci or Eminonu. I got my dinner at restaurant of AGAN. Generally i dont eat too much but there i could not say "stop" to myself, because every dish i took was extremely tasty. There at AGAN was a lot guests(as usually) and i found some new friends.So now i will wait my summer trip to Istanbul, and i look forward to come to my "second home" AGAN again! Thank you, AGAN, i love you, you know that!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: p-netSA
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for good value for money ...then this one is for you. The + side , good value for money , close to all attractions and transport ( tram , train ) .Friendly staff . The negitives ....walls paper thin ( light sleepers be aware ) breakfast: cold platters of not much . Close to mosque so the screaming matches between them early in the morning can wake the dead ( but i doubt you will get away from this anywere in Istanbul ) Over all I would stay here again based on cost and the staff . Suggestion try book on top floors as the pubs and restaurants on ground floor can get a bit noisy . Ozi a real gem ...ask him for help on anything .

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Jules-and-Lloyd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times, as so well located just minutes from the Blue Mosque etc. Great value, good welcome and the revamped rooms are really improved. Bathrooms are small but have everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: KOUTSOGIANNIS
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets the super 5G,great place,great staff,great location,great food,great value for your money,stop looking elsewhere this the most ideal place in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Aimee T
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel in the center of Istanbul.Well located: near the closest transportation and with plenty of shops around. The service of the hotel was excellent with always a smile and attention for us. The people were considerate and listening to our needs. The small restaurant belonging to the hotel was tasty and serving big plates of foods. The rooms are big , spacious and clean. The prices are good. We recommand this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Agan Hotel - very good value”
Reviews.Author: cbg1953
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the Hotel Agan over Xmas this year on the basis of recommendations on Trip Advisor. I must say that I was very pleased with the experience. The staff are very helpful and particularly the manager Turgut - they all go out of their way to make your stay a pleasant one. There is a nice indoor bar and restaurant on the ground floor also with some outdoor seating with heaters for cold weather. Food was good and reasonably priced. The Hotel was clean and tidy and in the Sultanamet district so very close to all the major attractions and Sirkeci station - 5 minutes walk and I was glad I chose somewhere convenient. I booked a Taxi from the airport which cost 60 TL (Â£20 ish) through the Agan. On my way back I got the shuttle bus which the manager Turgut provided free of charge. I really couldnt fault the Hotel for the money and would it recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent staff”
Reviews.Author: KarinaFGomes
Reviews.Content: My experience in Hotel Agan was the best. The location is good, near important atractions and public transport, is easy to do everything by yourself. The reception staff is very friendly, they helped me with everything I needed and always with a smile in face. I had a great time in Hotel Agan.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Graham W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly recommended. The location is easy to find but you should ask the hotel to email those directions to you. The room I occupied was very clean and serviced daily. The staff were very friendly, especially Turgut at reception. He freely offered his help whenever he thought something was required by you, and was very helpful in making reservations and in my case changing those reservations. He displayed a manner that nothing was a problem for him. Having a restaurant attached to the hotel was also great, and the meals were of excellent quality and quantity, as was the daily breakfast. For tourism the hotel is extremely well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Desertglow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in this hotel. It is easy to find, close to all the main attractions in the old city, Sultanahmet where Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophie, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Blue Mosque and just 5-8 minutes walk away from the ferry terminals to most cruises in Istanbul. It is also near to the Gulhane tram station and cost only TL2 to anywhere on the same line. The rooms are clean and sufficiently big for my husband and I. The beds were comfortable and although there were some noises from the restaurant downstairs till midnight, we were too tired to be bothered by it. The buffet breakfast was good and has a variety of choices. The 24hour free internet service was fabulous and the staff were very pleasant, polite and helpful in ensuring everything went smoothly for us during our stay. Thanks especially to Turgut at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay...”
Reviews.Author: SETA1
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Istanbul I would highly recommend staying at Agan Hotel - the managers and staff go above and beyond to assist you with your stay. From their warm welcome of apple tea to assisting one with the best places to visit! There is always a warm smile when you arrive back at the hotel after a long day of sight seeing (the location is walking distance to all the major sights). The room I got was just a standard one as I was traveling solo - albeit it was "standard" - it has all the amenities necessary for me including heating as it was rather cold when I visited in November. I hope to travel back to Istanbul in the new year and will be definately staying at the Agan hotel - thank you all for your kind welcome and assisting me as a solo traveller. Susan - Dubai

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tincelj
Reviews.Content: my friend and I stayed in this hotel for a week about one month ago. and i don't have anything bad to write about it. like I have already written in the title of the review the staff was always prepared to help and they were very friendly, and a bit flirty :) the hotel is located on a great spot, where everything in the old town Sultanahmed is reachable by foot. still if somebody doesn't want to walk much, there are two tram stops nearby the hotel (500 m away). the only bad part of the hotel is that, it faces a noisy street (there are few restorants around the hotel). but as we were there in October, there was not so much noise, because it was pretty cold and people ate inside the restaurants. I must also say taht the hotel has it's own entertainer, who every evening plays the guitar and sings for the guests. he is very amusing :) the rooms are very clean and big enough. our compliments to the cleaning lady. so, I have nothing bad to say about our staying here. everything was great and amazing, as also Istanbul is. I hope I will return soon. xoxo to all the staff from Tea&Tina

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: betteyUk
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from istanbul, we stayed at the agan hotel, this hotel is fab, the staff are grate , the rooms very clean and warm, the food good , the breakfast was more than good , we had a grate time in istanbul, and i think haveing a good hotel to go back to after a long day sightseeing makes your stay better. well done agan hotel you have got it right, we will stay again. from sheila and david.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great place!”
Reviews.Author: roxana b
Reviews.Content: AGAN Hotel was a pleasant experience. Everything is great, starting with the rooms and staff. They have a great restaurant with very good food and at night live music. For us this place is the best Turkish hospitality proof. Katy&Roxana

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lorbutcher
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October and loved every minute what a warm welcome from Murat and co, the hotel is clean, staff are very friendly, although the room was small not a problem as we only slept here as we were sightseeing all day every day all the sights are within walking distance and the salute restaurant is above average food is fresh, reasonably priced and there's entertainment from Tarek and his guitar. I cant wait to return again in the summer and would recommend this hotel and restaurant to all.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: SusieLikes2Travel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agan was a very nice place to stay. We stayed in the suite and loved the room! The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was spacious, and had room to spread out. The hotel staff was very helpful and fun to visit with. The breakfast buffet was traditional European fare and we loved it! The only drawback is the noise. I have a hunch that would be the case in about any hotel in Istanbul though. Nightlife seems to thrive here and the early morning call to prayer is heard all over the city. The restaurant hosts at the restaurants along the street are quite persistant, so that can be a little overwhelming at first, but once you get used to it and they know who you are, they can be quite helpful. We were extremely pleased with our stay at Hotel Agan and will stay here again if/when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: SjLondon29
Reviews.Content: Being my 3rd time staying in Hotel Agan i had another great stay, stayed here in October for 4 days while being in Fethiye. Having being use too a suite we only had a double room this time which was lovely and decorated very nicely but was abit on the small side which did not bother us as we only slept there. Agan is in a great location in Sirkeci walking distance too Hagia Sophia, blue mosque, bascilla cistern and plenty more, lovely restaurants in Sirkeci and Sultanahmet area or in Eminonu by the river. Would recommend a visit too the spice market instead off the grand bazaar easier to walk round as not so big and crowded. Would recommend this hotel to family and friends and can't wait too return in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal - if you avoid my rough edges”
Reviews.Author: The_Boarder_Line
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agan was very nearly exactly what Iâ€™d hoped for when booking. There were two snags, though â€“ so I want to advise you how to react in the unlikely event that one happens to you â€¦ because apart from my misfortunes, this is a pretty terrific place that you should enjoy. Issue #1 was a reservations foul-up, resulting in my first night being spent in a nearby competitor â€“ who put me in a drastically deficient room. The day after, I discussed this at length with Aganâ€™s gracious staff, who seemed genuinely regretful yet unable to compensate me beyond a beer or a shuttle to the airport. In the off chance that you wind up down the street in a tiny room with a lumpy bed, broken window, no TV remote or security lock and a brick-wall view, tell Hotel Agan immediately. Aganâ€™s rooms are far better than that, and (as in all things) they will want to make things right for you â€“ only itâ€™s more easily fixed before the poorer room is endured. Itâ€™s a hassle and a time drain, so weigh accordingly. Issue #2 is the hotelâ€™s thin walls. It was noticeable but not a problem until the final night, when a party next door cranked up at 2AM til sunrise. Noisy guests can happen anywhere, but thereâ€™s less insulation here from bad neighbors. On the other hand, I toughed it out instead of banging on the wall or alerting the front desk; either action might have fixed things. (Here and elsewhere, I found that Istanbul pretty much demands pushback.) Those issues aside? I really liked Agan. My room was clean, attractive, and very comfortable; it offered a swell neighborhood view, and had the perfect undertone of lively street life in the evening. Room amenities are rather generous for such reasonably priced lodging. Location is marvelous, a quick walk to both Sultanahmet and Eminonu. Aganâ€™s adjoining restaurant provided the most extensive free breakfast of my travels in Turkey. The staff has warmth and class, even when relocating me or dealing with my complaints; the first night snafu put me politely at odds in some ways, and Iâ€™m sorry I lost the likely pleasure of easy interaction with Aganâ€™s folks. All told, I only had a three-star time here. But Iâ€™m willing to believe circumstances were unusual, and I suspect other guests will only experience the many things Agan does so well.

Reviews.Title: “front desk staff on the take”
Reviews.Author: jim-explorer
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to almost 40 countries and I am used to people trying to take advantage of the "tourist", but having the hotel front desk staff change/inflate prices of services to make some $ for themselves is a new one for me. Once they get rid of the thief (one can hope!) - I would recommend the place - location is perfect, rooms are clean. Rooms are a bit small in case you are a bit "precious", but for the price - it is great. You can always go now, but don't use any of the services offered. They tried to rob me on a simple car service to the airport, not one of the "tours" they promote. I had to use a car service or taxi as it was a 4AM flight and I could not use the easy tram/light rail option at that hour without giving up sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Janet_D_11AlbanyWA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Agan and had a fantastic stay. My room was clean, the staff very helpful and they had a great breakfast selection. Hotel Agan was also walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, etc. As a lone female traveller, I felt safe and comfortable in the area. Would definitely come again and recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel, reasonable prices, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Omar_in_San_Diego
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Agan 6 or 7 times, each time the staff (Murad, Talat, and everyone else) have been superb. The rooms are good, and if there is any problem with the room, it is quickly fixed. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: deckhandoug
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right off the tram line. Easy walking distance to all the sights. Great pre cruise hotel

Reviews.Title: “great location, superb staff, some rooms a little shabby”
Reviews.Author: PhillKentUK
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. really helpful and friendly staff. some rooms were great, others a little shabby (cracked sink for example) quiet location at night. there were 3 in our party

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: wanderingstar2
Reviews.Content: We three travellers have had a great second visit to the Hotel Agan in 12 months. The locations is second to none between one of the main transport hubs in the city and some of the major sights, eg. Topkapi and Hagia Sophia. The room on the top floor was quite peaceful and spotlessly clean, the breakfast was substantial, fresh and tasty and the staff are friendly. Particular thanks to the lovely booking manager, Ayca, and Talat at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary, Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ovbruce
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Agan! All of my expectations were exceeded. The convenient location, when coupled with the warmth and hospitality of the amazing staff, helped create a truly memorable experience. Thank you Talat and Turgut (front desk personnel), and to the affable- and shockingly funny- hotel and restaurant manager I was able to have tea with one afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yulia K
Reviews.Content: Very good and helpful staff, nice location (near the tram-station, not far from Aya Sofia and not far from Galata Bridge), good breakfast,comfortable rooms (not noisy). I recommed it for best Istanbul trip.

Reviews.Title: “Solo stay can be a getaway....”
Reviews.Author: MaCarmelita
Reviews.Content: My 5 days stay in Hotel Agan is great! I did not expect to get a real decent, nice hotel in Istanbul with the price I get from their holiday package. Staff are all helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel itself is so great that it's just a 10-minute walk to Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, etc., trams and buses are just literally down the road. I did enjoyed my vacation and I will definitely be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocrity is not in the vocabulary”
Reviews.Author: TerryLyons
Reviews.Content: Can't speak too highly about the staff, the hotel and the location. From the very first and very prompt e-mail to day we left the service was excellent. In an age where mediocrity is the norm and you get the feeling that hotel staff 'paint ' their smiles on, the staff at Agan genuinely care about their guests. I found that my room was a little noisy. I asked if it were possible to change. Not only was it changed the second room was bigger and there was no extra charge. The buffet breakfast included fresh fruit every day. The cherries were wonderful. The three front desk managers were, in a word, fantastic. They gave information and advice as if you were a friend. They came and chatted if you were sitting outside and even recommeded restaurants other than their own. The wait staff were attentive, and unlike some restaurants did not rush you to order. If you are looking for a small hotel at a reasonable price this IS the one to try. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending the Agan hotel. If you do go, tell them Terry from Korea says hello.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorbutcher
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and clean we stayed in a double suite with jacuzzi bath maid service every day cannot fault the hotel the staff were friendly and helpful especially Murat at reception he booked us trips and gave us a lot of tips about the area and interesting places to visit. The restaraunt is situated beneath the hotel the food is good, breakfast is typically turkish with lots of choice. We had no problem with the noise as its usual for Turkish bars to stay open late. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as a base whilest sightseeing as its an ideal location 10mins to Blue Mosque, Sophia Hagla, Grand Bazaar and 5mins to River Bosphoros and the hustle and bustle of Istanbul theres plenty of fast food if you're on a budget namely Macdonalds, Burger king etc.

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable, friendly and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: OneMorePlacetoEat
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agan in the Sultanahmet, the old city of Istanbul, is just a few blocks walk from the Blue Mosque, Haiga Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and the Spice Market. Connection to the airport is easy (subway changing to light rail) and only a quick walk down the hill to the ferry docks on the Bosporus. The staff are young and helpful, the breakfast almost excessive and rooms comfortable. My wife and I usually avoid heavily tourist areas but this was a good choice. The staff told us where they ate so we avoided the tourist traps. The Kadikoy ferry took us to a great market without tourists, good restaurants and another side of Istanbul. OK, OK, the band was loud at night but the singer, one of the staff, was good.

Reviews.Title: “I like it and I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Amidamaru
Reviews.Content: Planing a 4 days trip to Istanbul I've chosen this hotel from a hundred and more without knowing basically a think about it or his location. I was very positively surprised to find a very worm people, a cozy room filled discretely with traditional details located just to a walk distance from the most important objectives like Sophia Mosque and so. Bottom line I have payed for less and I have obtained more than I have ever expected as fiends, great people and quality time by walking over the Istanbul old city streets. -Johnny

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: bostbstr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three weeks when I started learning Turkish. The people at the hotel were very helpful and put up with my attempts at talking Turkish. The room was better than I expected and with the aircondition I was able to sleep in the heat. Very good WiFi made it possible for me to videochat with my kids when they missed me, and to show people at home what I was doing in Istanbul. I hope I can come back soon with my family and to speak even better Turkish than when I left.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy at night due to the bar downstairs.”
Reviews.Author: ReviewMaster2000
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul to be centrally located. Knowing this was the touristy area we had some idea of what to expect. Nothing however prepared us for this place. Finding the entrance was a bit tricky as all you see is the bar outside with music blaring from it. The staff are mostly made up of 18-24 year old men who constantly had to ask one another how to do things such as run the card, find the room keys etc. They often were sitting outside in the bar area waiting for guests to come back and then try to convince them to have a drink with them in the bar. The room was pretty small with what looked like lady Gaga music video decor. (looked better in the picture online). The flat screen TV had a complex set up to get it to work with the satellite system but overall was fine. A/C worked but we had to go and ask for the remote from reception which of course required the man/boy working the desk to go off and ask someone else where it was and then find some batteries for it. The room was clean and once the A/C was going it was ok. Bathroom was clean with a decent shower. The small fridge didn't work or had run out of coolent. WIFI worked fine. The hallway noise on our floor was fairly tremendous. There was no sound insulation in this place at all. The main issues with the place arose a bit later in the evening. The before mentioned bar gets going around 8PM and does not stop until around 3AM. The bar apparently turns into a club with the music vibrating the entire place. Again the guys running the desk take over the bar and make it their own Discotechque at night. We should not forget the interlude of the singer/guitarist. He is one of the guys working at the hotel and knows five songs. Yes, literally five songs and he will play them in repeated fashion over and over again for about an hour (with guitar solo interludes) and he will be there every night. Getting to the hotel in the evening requires you to run a gauntlet of men standing in front of menus placed in lit glass covered tables. They will literally stand one after the other and try to force you to look at their menu. There are a minimum of five of these to get to the hotel door. This would be okay, if the fifth person wasn't one of the guys who worked at your own hotel and was constantly reminding you of the 6% (odd number) discount you get by drinking at the bar. Breakfast was buffet style. For one or two days would be bearable. After that, you'll be looking to find another place to go. Breads, spreads, feta cheese, fruit, olives, cereal, tea (strong), coffee (weak) is served in the bar in the morning. Multiple flatscreen TV's with music videos running are on all the walls. The stickiness from the night before is still somewhat to be found on the tables and chairs in the bar area. There is a litter of kittens that live outside and even though they are extremely cute to watch play, after seeing them run across all of the tables (having done a good job of grooming themselves prior) you start to get the idea that this place is 1 part hotel, 2 parts zoo. The finale ended with trying to book tickets on an airport shuttle. As we were leaving from the Asian side (further away) we decided this seemed to be the best and easiest way of getting there. We were reassured when we got there that the shuttles run everyday with no issue and to just get a ticket from someone at reception the day before leaving. So the afternoon before we take off, we go to the desk to buy our tickets. The kid (maybe 17?) at the desk starts to write out the ticket and takes the credit card. After swiping the card but not being able to figure out the CC machine, he asks the oldest of the group how to run the machine. This man asks why, and he tells him it's for tickets to the airport shuttle. The response is there is no airport shuttle for the next day. No reason for it, just no shuttle. However the sign for the shuttle bus was still in the lobby. We got there with tram, funicular, bus ride that required leaving four hours earlier than the shuttle would have. I think we would have had a much, much better time on our trip in Istanbul if we had not stayed here. The place was centrally located and easy to walk to the various tourist sights so at least were able to get away from it easily enough, but that isn't want you want in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I am very happy for such small money it was great.”
Reviews.Author: KazanAisha
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Istanbul. very convenient location, excellent staff. clean and comfortable rooms, excellent breakfast. I am very happy for such small money it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Way beyond expectations! Great place!”
Reviews.Author: RoJo36
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the money. The quality of facilities and service was beyond all expectations. A truly welcoming place! Many Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: etokintsurashvili
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agan is a very lovely hotel for a good price and people who work there are wonderful, very friendly and helpful. I and my sisters enjoyed our time in Istanbul very much and this was partly because of the hotel Agan and its staff. The hotel is clean, comfortable, good location and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Bunch”
Reviews.Author: Freebeeez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Sept 2010. I team is young and fun. Service is good and the rate is great. It's close to everything from Agia Sofia, the underground Citerns, Blue Mosque, the harbor, the train station bringing you to the beaches situated in Yesilkoy. Quite easy to get to from the airport you take the subway and then the tram and there you go. Rooms are very clean and of decent size and room services is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ptizechovka
Reviews.Content: This is a superbly located hotel - right in the middle of all the city has to offer. The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable, the staff are very helpful and friendly. This accomodation was excellent value for money and it will be our first choice on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: AmericanInEurope02
Reviews.Content: Just another backup of the existing reviews. Friendly and helpful staff, great breakfast, excellent location just the noise from the surrounding restaurants. I had no real problems with the noise but the friend I was with did and kept his window close until late at night and then did not have much problem except from wildlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SjLondon29
Reviews.Content: Came too Istanbul in November with a large group off friend's for the weekend and loved it so much decided too come back. Used this hotel as a base in Istanbul as we travelled here mainly too watch the Formula 1, Very glad we picked this hotel when we checked in we was upgraded too a suite which was lovely a very large double bed lovely furniture and a very nice en-suite bathroom with a jacuzzi bath tub. Staff were lovely and very helpful will do anything too help you out, Book an full day Istanbul tour as me and my mum was very ill that day we decdied not too go and just lose the money we paid for the trip and we was fine with that, Murat on reception played about abit and was able too rebook our tour for the day we was leaving so we was very grateful for him doing that. Breakfast was good ate there every morning was just a typical Turkish breakfast but very filling and good value for money. Hotel Agan is set in a great spot off Istanbul 5 min walk from Blue mosque, Hagia shopia and Topkapi palace, Grand bazzar is a 10 min walk and Bosphorus river only 10 mins walk. Eat most night's in Salute restaurant downstairs great bunch off boy's that work there very fun, Food was nice and resonably priced. Coming back too Istanbul in January and i hope too stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing the sights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: chromeyellow
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at Hotel Agan and would recommend to anyone wanting a reasonably priced short break in the city. Location is brilliant - just a short walk from Aghia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the archaeological museum. Room and ensuite shower room were comfortable and clean (although a bit on the small side). We looked out onto the pedestrianised street. Quite a lot of noise from restaurant opposite - from music and from large chimney/ventilation shaft - but all was quiet from just after midnight so not a problem and we slept really well. Considering we were in the middle of a large city, we weren't bothered by traffic noise at all. Wide range of food available at breakfast buffet. Residents get 10% off dinner at the Salute Restaurant: good value although a bit heavy on the carbs (rice, chips and flat bread all on one plate a bit much for us). Staff friendly and helpful. Lots we didn't have chance to do in the short time we were there. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NKS123
Reviews.Content: Very good clean hotel in the centre of sultanahmet area with great restaurants all arround. The people were very helpful and allowed us to take printouts and even packed our breakfast for an early morning flight. Would definitely recommend. Only shortcoming may be that the area is a bit noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ivaova
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to all travelers who would like to stay in perfect hotel in the centre of old city with great staff, nice restaurant, great meal, delicious water pipes and whatever you want you will get. Rooms were little bit smaller, but in perfect condition, renovated and cleaned every day.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected and more.”
Reviews.Author: alizarules
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Agan. and was grateful for the other TripAdvisor reviews because I knew exactly what to expect. The restaurant across the street was very loud and went on pretty late for a few nights, but I can sleep through anything. The rooms were small but the bathrooms were actually a nice size given that most small hotels have tiny bathrooms. The hotel staff was very professional and helpful. Hello toTalat, Murat and Turgut. The restaurant staff was a little annoying (no more so than any other restaurant) but: a) many of them are young and b) they were just doing their job. The food was good and the outdoors seating was great for people watching. Will stay there again. Patty aka "angel"

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, perfect location, easy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: markkula
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, small but nice and clean room, coupled with a quite good Turkish restaurant with 10% discount for hotel guests. Walking distance to pretty much all the main historic attractions. Breakfast was ok but not top notch and our room was quite noisy from the restaurant across the street until about midnight, but with earplugs we had no problems sleeping and we'd defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Great Location And Staff”
Reviews.Author: Daceyfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my wife and two teenage sons. Had a great time. The hotel staff are excellent. The surrounding area has all the major attractions(topkapi, Haji Sofia, Grand bazaar, blue mosque spice market etc etc) within walking distance and is buzzy and lively. its not quiet, there is always a lot happening until late on the cushions which line the street. We enjoyed that, but others might prefer a less lively location. The hotel is clean, the rooms are good and the service is great. I've stayed in other hotels nearby and this is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very kindly staff!”
Reviews.Author: HavaFatih
Reviews.Content: I liked the location, its near sultanahmet, aya sophia, topkapi palace and another important and very beatifull places. Very kindly staff and clean rooms. Good food and nice place outside to relax with turkisch coffee. Finally a great hotel to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: LancasterLad
Reviews.Content: The Agan is in a great location. Sultanahmet with all it has to offer is a few minutes easy walk away, as is the public ferry area of Eminonu, and the Spice Bazaar. We got a very good deal with Travel Republic. The hotel was very clean, secure, and the young staff keen to please. The hotel has a lift and we were on the 3rd floor. Our room was a decent size, or rather would have been had it not been turned into a triple. With that extra single bed there was very little room to move. The bathroom was fine and the shower pressure very good. Breakfast was in the downstairs bar/restaurant, and is excellent. Free internet is available, just one PC though. There was some external noise at night, but that died down at about 2300. We got some noise from the room next to us at 0230, but my Mrs sorted that out! The hotel can arrange transfers and tours. Excellent vfm!

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: afar_11
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, the room was very, clean and the staff were at all times friendly and helpful. As an added bonus, the restaurant attached was very good (the only place we decided to eat twice in our stay), and the staff very lively and entertaining. The only downsides were the Hotel Ozler next door has a live music show every night, and can be heard if your room is on that side, and it is in the middle of a pedestrianized area full of restaurants, so you may have to run gauntlet several times a day. (Be courteous and genuine and you will find this much easier). On the other hand, we did try some of the other cafes and restaurants in the vicinity, and they were also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff at Hotel Agan is really something special!”
Reviews.Author: EileenLa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agan was a wonderful place to stay for 8 nights on our recent trip to Istanbul. The hotel was clean, convenient, easy to find, and set in a great neighborhood close to many of the major sites such as Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, and the Basilica Cistern. It is also very close to the Tram line so we were able to use public transit very easily to get to sites farther away from our hotel. Also, the great staff helped us figure out which bus to take to locations off the Tram line. One of the best things about Istanbul were the wonderfully friendly people we met every day there. The people at Hotel Agan were no exception. The absolute best part about this hotel was the staff. They made us feel very welcome immediately upon our arrival and made sure to make us feel at home during our entire stay. I have already recommended Hotel Agan to many friends traveling to Istanbul, and I myself would love to go back and stay there again! It was a good value, the breakfast was nice to have right there in the hotel, and the outdoor bar seating area was a very comfortable and relaxing area to sit and soak up Istanbul. The rooms were a bit small but this was not a big deal at all. We were two people in a room with two single beds and it worked fine for us. The bathroom was plenty spacious. The street outside was a bit noisy late at night, but again - this was no big deal. This is all part of staying in a big city. It was a fun to look out the window and watch the street scene. A couple of times at breakfast the scrambled eggs in the warmer were slightly less than warm, but overall I thought the breakfast was great. Again, the best things about this place were the price, location, and above all - the wonderfully amazing staff. Thank you Murat, Talat, Muslum, and everyone at Hotel Agan!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bagofcorn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great value for the money! The rooms are small, but nicely decorated with all amenities. We did have a problem with the hot water in the shower - it kept switching between very hot and very cold. The location is great - within 10 min walk of Hagia Sofia and also close to a tram station. The complimentary breakfast could have been better; mostly it was cold, pimento loaf/bologna cold cuts. The staff was very helpful, and when we left they bid us goodbye like we were family!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SarahC05
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agan is a great place to stay. It was clean and centrally located, near historical sites and the tram. The staff at both the hotel and restaurant are super friendly and helpful. Talat and Murat go out of their way to make you feel welcomed. The rooms are small, so if you are looking for a hotel with more space, then this is not the place for you. We spent very little time in our hotel room. We had such a great time in Istanbul and enjoyed our stay at this hotel! We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Annoying Restaurant Staff the only Downside”
Reviews.Author: GrahamRS
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Agan in January 2011. The room was very nice, there was wireless internet, included breakfast, great toiletries. The room was cleaned each day, the front desk was helpful also. It is also near the tram line. The restaurant staff workers are incredibly annoying though. Every time you enter or leave the hotel they are on you, pressuring you into eating at the restaurant. After staying there 4 days many of the staff seemed not to recognize us and asked what country we were from about 50 times. It got old really fast. If this hotel wants to improve vastly and easily just tone down the salesmen, I can speak for most tourists that we absolutely hate the pressured restaurant sell and many times will avoid those restaurants if possible. Besides that, the hotel was cheap and really nice. Make sure to utilize the airport shuttle provided by the hotel as it is actually cheaper and taxis have a hard time finding the place. As well, you must realize that the area surrounding the hotel is touristy and the restaurants are all about 3x more expensive than you can find in other areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it!”
Reviews.Author: SabinaRogala
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Agan for 6 nights.The room and bathroom were very small. We weren't impressed by the staff,especially the resturant staff.They were quite annoying trying to convice us to eat in their restaurant.Breakfast was quite tasty,though.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly nice hotel nearby everything”
Reviews.Author: Heguli
Reviews.Content: Reasonable priced, well situated (+tram), friendly (greetings to Talat) small hotel in the very centre of Istanbul! Simply breakfast, thin walls!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: Lostintime1389
Reviews.Content: The hotel pictures make this place out to be very very nice with large rooms. The room was VERY small and the bathroom was so small that I'm surprised they could actually fit everything in there. We could not sleep very much because there was construction all night 2 streets away and the windows were not very sound proof. The soundproofing between rooms was also lacking... no one wants to wake up to moaning/mooing sounds at 9 in the morning. Adding to our lack of sleep was a double bed with a twin blanket (or at least a blanket that was way to small) for the two of us, which would have been fine for one but left us in a blanket tug of war all night. Also, we put our do not disturb sign on the door, but the maid tried to open the door several times while we were sleeping and then finally she knocked until we woke up and handed us some towels. Granted it was 1 in the afternoon, but if I want to sleep until 1 I will. In addition, the street that the hotel is on is lined with restaurants, which would be great, you would think....except in Istanbul they insist on trying to grab your attention every time you walk past the restaurant and beg you to eat there... SO ANNOYING! This included the hotel restaurant where the man knew we were staying in the hotel and still harassed us every time we walked by... I definitely avoided eating at any restaurant that did this. The hotel is well located and the staff was very nice and accommodating, but there are about a million hotels that are all well located in Istanbul where you will find a great staff. And honestly if you find any hotel that's within walking distance of the blue line tram you are connected to all major tourist attractions, shopping and food no matter where you are.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: ehsan-aj
Reviews.Content: - We reserved the hotel for one week, at first day, our room was in first floor, very noisy, and while we were resting after arrival in the afternoon, some one unlocked the door and came in, for doing some conditioner thing, which we asked to come later,while we are out. - We asked for room change due to loud noises, and went to 5th floor, which the bath and some parts of our room was leaking form ceiling due to the rain. - Again, asked for changing room for second time, where the sattelite was not working and we called and asked for some help, which they came after 3rd time calling in 2 days. - the breakfast was so simple and not even one warm serves except drinks, so boring. - the reception man tried to be nice but not much respectful. - the room's warming system was on and off randomly. - one more thing; during the one-week stay, bed sheets never got changed, not once. It was a total disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good price.”
Reviews.Author: Alefzero
Reviews.Content: At a very short walking distance from Aya Sophia, Topkapi, tramway station, restaurants and bars and for 40 euros (the first night and 35 euros the following), it is hard to ask for more from Istanbul hotel. Our room was spacious enough and the shower cabin was excellent. The pillows and small tables outside provide a nice place to eat or drink something or just to have a rest. Very friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: RenoJess
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked this hotel for 5 nights and for the price of 35 euros each night, we were a little skeptical as to what the hotel would be like. We were very pleased by how nice and roomy our room was. Everything was very clean and the room has hardwood floor with tiles in the bathroom. The bed was quite comfortable we were provided with plenty of soft pillows. The location of this hotel is fantastic too because it is surrounded by restaurants and is a couple of blocks from the metro so it was quite easy to get around Istanbul; plus, we walked in the Sultanahmet area daily. We didn't didn't get up early enough to eat the complimentary breakfast but we ate dinner one night at the restaurant and it was pretty good. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks, Hotel Agan!!

Reviews.Title: “Best buy for the money in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JohnRogers7
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, close to major attractions, public transportation nearby, rooms equal to many of those in 4-star hotels, although a few are smaller, 5-star bathrooms. The building is next to many restaurants with both indoor and outdoor seating. Delicious breakfast was available--not Western though. There is a bar and restaurant on the premises. Management staff was very friendly and cooperative, especially Talat, Turgut, and Okan. Tours through the hotel are available with a guide. TV, small, flat screen with many international channels available, excellent mattresses. After checking out over 200 hotels, I decided to go with this 1.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and value”
Reviews.Author: Jack1121
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Agan hotel. Talat at the front desk was very friendly and helped with any local info we needed. My wife was leary of staying at 2 star, but everything was great. The breakfast doesnt have much variety, but its a good start if you are hungry. Nice comfy pillows out front in restaurant to enjoy a drink after a hard day touring

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: jonsey_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and had a great stay. The hotel is 10min walk from the blue mosque, aya sofya and the basilica cistern and five minutes walk from tram stop gulhane. There is also plenty of resturants nearby, pasazade was my favourite!!! The brekfast was OK but it was great being able to sit on the big cushions outside and have a drink and the free internet was handy. I woul have loved to stay one more night and would happily return here

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: Tia915
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights, and we have nothing but good things to say about this place. The suite was very spacious and incredibly clean, which is the most important thing to me. The bathroom was nice and spcaious and the jacuzzi tub was very relaxing after a long day. The service was exceptional, all the staff from the concierge to the dining staff were fantastic, very attentive to our needs and requests. This hotel is listed as a 3 star but i would definately consider it a 4 star, and for the price we paid, we could not have been happier. The hotel itself can be a bit difficult to find once you get off the tram stop for the first time but once you recognice the street then its quite easy to get to and from the hotel. It is very conveniently located about 15 minute walk to Sultanahmet's attractions such as Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia, and about a 2minute walk to the Gulhane tram stop. This was a wonderful place, and the breakfast was very good every morning, lots of breads, cheeses, assorted meats, olives, fruits, and boiled eggs and scrambled eggs. There's more than enough food to fill you up to get you started for a long day of site seeing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone whether you are a couple of travelling with kids. Hotel Agan was truly a great part of our Istanbul experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: badgerc04
Reviews.Content: Young and friendly staff. Hotel was very conveniently located and a 5 minute walk to the metro. Close to bars and restaurants and can get a bit noisy at night, but it didn't bother us one bit. The room was very spacious with a queen bed, sitting area, work desk, flat screen tv, and jacuzzi tub. Most importantly, it was very clean and exceeded our expectations. Would highly recommend if you are looking for a clean and comfortable hotel on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: wanderingstar2
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in Istanbul having stayed in this little gem of a hotel. Great value for money and an unbeatable location close to a major transport hub (tram and ferry) and sights such as the Topkapi Palace, Basilica cistern, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It's a casual place with young staff, some of the lads are fairly cool dudes! The en suite room was spotless on the top floor. Breakfast was wonderful with a wide selection of super fresh breads, fruit, cheeses, vegetables, cakes, yoghurt and cereals. Plenty of tea and coffee too. Could not recommend it more highly on value for money and location. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BobP19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and found the hotel to be very good value for money. Although the room was small it was clean and well kept. The shower room was extremely small but it was clean and the hotel provided the usual soap, shampoo and shower caps. The hotel could not be better placed for the main tourist attractions - most within easy walking distance. The area around the hotel has many restaurants and our room faced a busy street which meant that there was quite a bit of evening noise. However closing the windows and switching on the aircon cut out the street noise virtually completely. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly - especially Talat on reception - and the breakfast of cold cuts, salad, cheese, breads and cereals together with scrambled eggs was a good way to start the day. Would not recommend the hotel for a long stay due to the small room size but it is more than adequate for two or three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Neat location”
Reviews.Author: Vivi_y_Andres
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a little street full of restaurant/bars that have outside sitting on traditional pillows and carpets. Hotel staff was cordial and helpful, the hotel was clean although it seems a little old and run down. The rooms are a bit small and you may get some noise from the street depending on your location (room 303). The breakfast was ok, veggies in the morning may take a little for some of us to accept. There is a metro (more like a light train) 2 blocks from the hotel. We used it to get to and from the airport, one transfer and 6 liras total for 2. Overall the hotel met expectations from the reviews I read prior to our visit.

Reviews.Title: “just getting better”
Reviews.Author: ipoksane
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this hotel couple of times during last few years. It is a pleasure to come back and see this place is improving its service. Also, the hotel has been recently renovated, which, with no doubt, just improves the overall good feeling about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great option”
Reviews.Author: Calasan
Reviews.Content: Good staff, always ready to help; easy on line reservation; GREAT LOCATION; the room and the bathroom are clean; free internet (but there are too few computers); and the breakfast could be better.

Reviews.Title: “A great find.”
Reviews.Author: NJK1234
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the old town of Istanbul. Great location 5 minutes walk from the main bus station and waterfront. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel also had a great little restaurant with huge cushions outside, food was actually really great and reasonable price. One of the bar men even got his guitar out most nights for a sing song. Great place and highly recommended for a weekend in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent- all recomendation”
Reviews.Author: rusmir
Reviews.Content: Hotel has excellent location, polite staff. Almost all rooms are like new (recently done i suppose). Breakfast-excellent. Free internet, mayble little noisi outside but pople like to enjoy Istanbul :) One bed was OK other one was almost destroyed (room 302). But I was alone and this was not problem. If I ever come again I will take this hotel for sure! Rusmir Baljic, Sarajevo

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Needs11
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip last minute and got an amazing deal at Hotel Agan (even though it was peek season). When I arrived (my flight was late) I was greeted by friendly staff. The hotel location is great! Close to many of the tourist attractions and close to a tram so you can take it to Takism. I have been to Istanbul a few times now and so far this has been the best hotel I have stayed at. I was supposed to head to another location in Turkey but something came up and I had to stay in Istanbul. The hotel was booked so I wasn't able to extend my reservation but the staff was very helpful and they helped me find another hotel in Sirkeci close to Hotel Agan at a really good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: mar2nia
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very clean, staff helpful and friendly, good breakfast selection, excellent location (walking distance to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar). Great value for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - dont plan on catching any sleep”
Reviews.Author: thomasnielsen67
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom tiny. The "free" breakfast was a complete joke. Location is fine Extremely noisy - until very late in the evening (morning for some people) people roamed around inside the hotel and drank/ate/shouted/laughed on the sidewalk just outside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to say in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: skiowl
Reviews.Content: Staff couldn't have been more helpful, Arrived early and had no problems. Had a very early morning pick up and again very helpful. Room was fantastic, better than expected and even though it is close to restaurants and night life, you couldn't hear any noise in your room. Would recommoned this hotel to everyone... We will defiantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jonquil24
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agan is a lovely place to stay while in Istanbul. It deserves more stars than 2. The rooms were great; the staffs were friendly and helpful. The location is perfect. We were able to walk to all the major sights. There's a nice area outside the hotel where you can relax in the evening and breakfast is included. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad option for Stanbul”
Reviews.Author: RomanSad
Reviews.Content: Location is good, at the most attractive tourist part of town, but in the immediate vicinity there are no monuments, are rather poor quality (unfortunately) restaurants. Hotel restaurant is also not recommendable, breakfast (in room price) definitly not delicious. Although the hotel is worth a visit. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. The staff is nice and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: oceanic_10
Reviews.Content: The location is great near the historical sites and docks and is ideal if you don't need to stay in the middle of Taksin nightlife. The staff was helpful and cleaning was very good. Fresh towels all the time and rooms cleaned well daily. I stayed a week and sheets were changed twice. The breakfast was good. The hotel has been renovated recently and everything is new. You can see in some details that the materials and work quality is not super - but still mostly very nice. Soundproofing lacks a bit. I must say that after taking everything into account (starting from the location), this is probably the best value-for-money hotel experience I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dmarkstravels
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. The food was good, the included breakfast just right for an early start. You couldn't ask for a better spot to start exploring the city, the hotel is just minutes from the tram, Blue Mosque, and many others. Easy access from the Airport on the tram. Great place to stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem..”
Reviews.Author: Neville91
Reviews.Content: The shuttle driver had a some difficulty in finding this hotel from the airport which was a little surprising given it's excellent central location for the main tourist spots of old Istanbul. We were a little worried as we negotiated the streets into the area as it all seemed a little seedy but this was a very false impression and we very quickly at ease once we got our bearings. We were early for check in but were able to leave our luggage and were assured of a room by noon - which we appreciated when we returned from a walk down to the railway station area. We were shown to a very nice room which was air conditioned and very clean with a quite modern feel about it. The jewel in the crown of the Agan would have to be the staff - they were just marvelous and a lot of fun. We were intrigued with the goings on as they competed in the most good hearted and friendly manner with their neighbouring businesses. We only had one evening meal at the hotel and it was very nice, the rest of the time we ran the gauntlet of the nearby restaraunts before making up our mind - this was actually great fun and should not be seen as a trial or an irritant. It is all good natured and some good deals can be made for a discounted meal. We intend returning to Istanbul and the hotel Agan will be my first choice for a room. Excellent value for money with the most amazing staff. Almost forgot to mention the breakfast which was complimentary to the room. A good selection of food and plenty of it providing for a great start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Welcoming Hotel, Friendly Staff, Recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: basimamin92
Reviews.Content: This hotel had very friendly staff and very helpful, clean and well air conditioned rooms. This rooms are a little tight but for the price you pay 100% value for money. i would definately recommend this hotel. This hotel is also very well located as is walking distance from everywhere you need to go. All thanks to mourad, talat (bruno) and the rest for a very happy stay ;).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: worteltje
Reviews.Content: - a small hotel where price and quality go hand in hand - small but very clean rooms - breakfast buffet: there is something for everyone - verry friendly staff - verry good service

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, excellent location, and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lilisfer
Reviews.Content: I came recently from my trip to Istanbul. I highly recommend this hotel. The room was clean and very comfortable. The location was excellent, it was close to everything. The price was perfect, and the breakfast which was included , was very good. The staff was always very helpful and kind. I definitely will stay in Hotel Agan, the next time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be faulted”
Reviews.Author: PurpleHankyMan
Reviews.Content: It really would be difficult to find fault with this hotel. It's evidently been renovated in the recent past, and although you wouldn't call the rooms especially spacious, they're well appointed and perfectly comfortable. Satellite TV and air con. in the rooms. The hotel is just 2 mins. from GÃ¼lhane tram station, so very easy to get to from AtatÃ¼rk International Airport using cheap public transport. Breakfast is ample, and there's loads of hot water. Staff are very helpful - they all speak English. I stayed for a week, and during that time had clean towels every day and the bed sheets changed twice. Sure, there's some street noise in the evenings, but this is Istanbul - if you want silence, find a nice Trappist monastery somewhere. :-) All in all, excellent value. Highly recommended, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there another time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent people, helpful, reasonable rates, wil stay again”
Reviews.Author: OzT
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room there June, arrived and asked to change to a twin as I discovered my son was also arriving to Istanbul later that day, he was on his overseas trip. They changed my single to a triple, for only 15 Euros a night extra, I was staying 2 nights. This is very comparable to a hostel rate in the area, so for 15euros extra my boy had a good bed, the room was comfortable, big double and a single bed, tele, excellent shower room, AIR CONNED!!! and free bath stuff and slippers provided. Room was cleaned every day, breakfast, which was included, was a good buffet. Hotel has free internet and is local to attractions and the docks as to get to Taksim, Istanbul centre. I would def recommend this hotel to anyone, for the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, the locations. Two tips I have for people staying at the Agan 1: From airport don't get taxi or shuttle bus, which can cost up to 20euros. Get the metro (M1) to Zeytinburnu, about 6/7 stops. All trams and transport uses tokens, which costs 1.5 Turkish liras, and you can get this at every station via the vending machines. At Zeytinburnu, change to tram line, I think it was T2, that goes to Gulhane. Get off there out the gate at the back, 1st street on right walk down to 3rd turning on right and hotel is there, about 300m from the stop. 3 Turkish Liras was about 1.5 Euros at the time compared to 20 Euros by taxis. 2: Don't have dinner in the area round the hotel. All the restaurants serves the same foods and charges about the same money. Instead, eat up in Taksim, which you get to by the same tram you came in on, across the bridge. Up there, where all the night clubs/bars/shopping are, youâ€™ll find a better choice of foods, much better atmosphere and here's the important thing, usually 1/3 to up to 1/2 the price you pay in the restaurants round the hotel. The above 2 tips are, of course, my views only and it is recommended you try others out. But 100% I would recommend the hotel to anyone! Happy travelling all!! :) OzT

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Istanbul sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: vioreldud
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a perfect location for Istanbul sightseeing. All the main atractions are very close, around 5 minutes walking distance. The rooms are nice and clean, the staff is friendly and helpful. The area is filled with nice restaurants, and there are 2 tram stations very close (Sirkeci and Gulhane) - the tram is the main public transport way in Istanbul. When I'll come back to Istanbul, I think I'll stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great location, good food and cozy area.”
Reviews.Author: kasclark
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff. Great food at the restaurant. Close to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. On a cozy pedestrian street with outside eating sitting. Small, clean room with ice cold air conditioning. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Rhi3
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Agan could hardly be better located - a very short walk from most of the major sights and museums of Istanbul in the Topkapi and Sultanahmet areas, with good tram connections to the Bazaar district and also close to the Bosphorus ferry docks and Sirkeci station. The rooms and en-suite bathrooms are clean and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful and speak good English. Cheap airport transfers are available. The breakfast buffet includes traditional Turkish as well as more Western options. The hotel restaurant and bar are slightly more expensive than nearby alternatives - the whole street is lined with hotels which have bars with outdoor seating areas. That last point means that the street stays busy and noisy until late at night, which can affect sleep. But all in all the Agan is an attractive option close to most of Istanbul's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for my fast 3 days in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rob_sad
Reviews.Content: It was my plan B, first reasonable booking at booking.com service. I made it just after flight booking with an idea to find something better in next weeks before my weekend trip to Istanbul. Of course, I tried to find something else, but my first choose was better than everything I could find. That isn't the best hotel, but I think it is worth your money if your travel with economic budget. I booked single room, but I got normal double room, with nice bathroom. Only one disadventage for me: juices. There are breakfasts for hotel guests (in room price) - everything was quite good - excluding juices.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel? More Like 3 Star!! Recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: jangir
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler I stayed at Hotel Agan in June 2010 for 3 nights. I had initially booked a single room but upon my arrival was upgraded to a suite - first piece of good fortune. I found the hotel to be clean and the staff to be super friendly, most of whom had a very good command of English. Hotel guests also get a small discount on food from the restaurant next door. Location wise, I found the hotel to be perfect for all the sights: Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and all the other HISTORICAL sights of Istanbul. Now I have written 'historical' in caps lock because if you are seeking to go to Istanbul to party the night away in bars and clubs, this location is NOT for you. If you are planning to travel to the Hotel from Sabiha Gokcen Airport (SAW) on a weekday be prepared to sit in traffic for a long time. During weekdays and Saturday the traffic in Istanbul can be crazy. I landed around 7pm on a Thursday and the traffic was so bad that the driver and the Hotel staff (whom the driver called) advised me to take the 15-20 minute ferry to the hotel - Agan is located about 5-10 minutes walk from the port. Paying for the ferry is about 2 Turkish Lira. If you are flying in from Istanbul Ataturk airport (IST) then on a good day it should take you about half hour to get to the Hotel (may be less). Now, although I have given the Hotel 5 stars for location, value for money, rooms and service, for sleep quality I have given it 2 stars. Why? Because right next to the Hotel are wonderful outside sofas (like being in your living room) and tables where visitors can relax, laugh and enjoy food (in large portions) and MUSIC. Music is played late into the night and you can hear the chatter and laughter of visitors from the bedrooms facing the entrance - I can't speak for the other rooms of course. Furthermore, there was a construction site not to far from the hotel and work goes on throughout the night. But both these negatives apply to ALL THE OTHER HOTELS located in this area. Please also be prepared to be woken up around 4-5 am every morning by the call to prayers from mosques dotted around the area. Another thing to note is the fact that rooms have no safety boxes. In fact these are located in reception. You are given a key and the receptionist keeps the other set. In order to open the safe both keys are needed. The only problem with this is: what would have happened if I had lost my set? The breakfast buffet (included in my reservation) is excellent. The Hotel also recommends different tours and I opted for an English tour guide run by Ulkesel Profesyonel Turist Rehberi. There is also free Internet access Finally, the Hotel is located around several Turkish Bath Houses. Although most people would advise to try traditional bath houses, I would recommend a more modern and upmarket Haman.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: SteveNM
Reviews.Content: I flew in from the Sabiha Gokcen airport on May 28, 2010, on a flight from London, Gatwick, via Easy Jet. Upon arriving at the airport, I was aware that a Visa was required, so I had my US Passport and $20 US ready when I lined up at the Visa entry. I showed my passport and paid my $20 and got through with no problems. Once you have your Visa, you can then go through Passport Checkin. The agents spoke English, so I was able to answer a couple of questions and was let through without any problems. I then followed the other passengers from my flight to the baggage claim area, and was able to retrieve my luggage within 10 minutes. There are signs in Turkish and English throughout the airport. Since this airport is located on the Asian side of Istanbul and my hotel was located on the other side, I had to make arrangements with an Airport Shuttle service (you can do this via internet), and had someone waiting for me with my name on a sheet of paper as I exited the airport baggage claim area. The shuttle picks up several people at the airport for 10 Euros ($6.50 US) and takes them to their destination hotels throughout Istanbul. Since we arrived at about 12:30 pm, we were unable to avoid traffic, and it took us approximately 1.5 hours to get from the airport to the hotel. So, use the bathroom before you leave the airport, and be patient â€˜cause the driving in Istanbul is crazy. When I got to the hotel Agan (pronounced ah-yawn), it was on a side street away from major traffic, but there were several restaurants/bars in the vicinity as well as within the hotel itself. I was met by hotel staff who were expecting me. I was assured ahead of time via e-mail in English that I could pay with a Visa Card, and they did accommodate, however, they changed the price from Euros to Turkish Lira, which essentially came out to the same amount I was quoted, so that was not an issue. Since I was trying to save money, I expected less, but Tripadvisor.com had some really good things to say about the hotel and its location, so I took a chance, and wasnâ€™t really disappointed. I was given a room on the 3rd floor right next to the elevator, but the room itself was quiet from within the facility. I was pleasantly surprised to find a well-kept, clean, neat room with two twin beds, air conditioner, shower/bathroom, etc. Other amenities included a refrigerator (which worked tepidly if at all), and wi-fi which was very temperamental. I finally gave up and used the hotel unit on the ground floor or used my own laptop on that level when it was convenient. A flat-screen TV was also available, but I didnâ€™t have time to really turn it on. Breakfast was also included with the stay. The room was large and comfortable but the a/c was not very powerful during the day. Unfortunately, some nights were too hot and others were too cold â€“ so what can you say. My window opened up to the restaurant side of the street, however, I was not seriously bothered by the music or talking (never blaring), and things pretty much got quieter by 11 pm. Once you closed your windows, the noise was almost non-existent, but I would recommend ear plugs for those who have problem with any noise in particular. The rooms were cleaned every day, and clean towels were provided. The bathroom fixtures appeared to be a little loose. When I used the WC in the hotel restaurant, I also noticed there were problems with the fixtures there as well. Cleanliness in the room was not an issue, but the restaurant WC could have used more attention; it seemed to have a perpetual leak. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant other than to partake of the breakfast which was included with my stay. I preferred eating at the smaller restaurants in more out of the way places. Breakfast was very generous with a variety of meats, cheeses, vegetables, olives, yogurt and fruit. Orange juice, coffee and hot water were also available, and there were a variety of breads (regular and local) with small packets of honey, jam, etc., to choose from. Milk and corn flakes were also available. Breakfast started at 7:00 am.
