I noticed after a large group of younger people checked into the hotel, there were slim pickings at the buffet if you got there late. I felt safe traveling as a single person and walking around at night by myself throughout the city and in the area where this hotel is located. There are a variety of restaurants, bars, nightclubs, and fast food places within walking distance. There are even a couple of small grocery stores where you can buy fruit, candy, beer, wine, etc., to take back to your room, at a much reduced rate than you would pay at a specialty or other stores. ATMs are also available within walking distance and in safe areas. Please note that anywhere you go in this part of town, there are a lot of people around, and traffic is always heavy except for late at night, but that was all part of the fun and excitement too. With regard to sightseeing, this location is fantastic. I was able to see 75% of what I had planned to see while in Istanbul without ever getting on a bus or tram or metro, which were all readily accessible within yards from the hotel. Of course that means you have to like to walk (a lot), but all of the major attractions were within walking distance. When I did use public transport, there were plenty of people to ask how the service worked, and after you do it once, youâ€™re a pro. There is a sightseeing cruise on the Bosphorus down near the Eminou landing that takes you for a 2-hour cruise up the Bosphorus and back for 10 TL â€“ you canâ€™t miss them, because they stand out shouting the tour and there are signs as well. It is not a â€œguidedâ€� tour, but it was more than worth the price of the ticket â€“ the guidebooks can give you all the info you need on what you will see. There are many facets to Istanbul and each quarter has its own flare. Going to Taxim square one night and walking along the shopping boulevard was a whole other Istanbul and a whole other experience, so get to as many places as you can and have the time for â€“ and walk as much as possible. I was a bit concerned about the language difference coming to Istanbul, but I found that most people do speak English, and they are generally very friendly and kind if you approach them in the same manner. People dress in every which way, but modesty does seem to prevail and is preferred. Turkish men rarely wear shorts but some do especially the younger ones. Women are more modest in their dress and get a lot of attention when they arenâ€™t. My only disappointment if I had one is that Istanbul is not very conscious of its litter and garbage problem and there is a problem with smoking and smog (from the cars, ships, etc.). People throw paper, plastic, whatever, without a thought as to where it winds up, and usually that is in the water or along the streets. Walking along the Galata Bridge, you see fisherman opening the plastic bags containing whatever fishing apparatus, and they throw the wrappers on the bridge where it eventually gets blown into the water â€“ what a shame. I kept thinking wouldnâ€™t it be great if they had an adopt a highway program, or some kind of program to teach young people (and old) about the problems associated with litter and pollution. I would definitely recommend this hotel and a visit to Istanbul â€“ it is a fascinating city with much to offer. I could have stayed another week.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jennababe
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small, but it was clean, the employees were very nice, good price and it was in a fabulous location (It is literally a 5 minute walk from the Mosques). I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Some of the kindest, most patient and hospitable people”
Reviews.Author: Smoo7882
Reviews.Content: Multiple friends that have visited Turkey before me informed me of the kind nature and warm hospitality of the Turkish people,and I certainly was not disappointed. Everywhere I walked down the street, shopkeepers and patrons alike would offer their advice and help. The workers at this hotel were no exception and were some of the kindest out there. The free breakfast was fantastic and fresh (with no shortage of Turkish coffee:) with a longer window than most others. I lost my iPhone and the workers actually were patient enough to not only call the restaurant I thought I lost it at, but walk back to the restaurant with me and were awesome enough to put up with my curtness. I will definitely go back to Istanbul and when I do I will make sure to stay here again and see all the wonderfully hard-working employees of Hotel Agan!!! I love them all!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Cheli_JC
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that provides just what you need if you're in the city: Breakfast, a good bed in a clean room and perfect location. It's clearly not a five-star hotel, but you get what you pay for, and I would say my husband and I were very satisfied. The breakfast is fulfulling, internet is provided and the safe as well, for free. The manager of the hotel is very attentive and friendly. The locations is simply ideal. You just walk to get to historical downtown and if you want to go further you just take the tram which is just 2 blocks away from the hotel. Just outside the hotel there are lots of restaurants and bars and even when they are there, I had no problems sleeping since they lowered the volume down at a certain time at night. I fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Real Hospitality!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nikolay1
Reviews.Content: Excellent place, modest price, helpful staff and good breakfast. The location is within walking distance of the main attractions. I visited this hotel three times. Last time with a group of friends and without the reservation (kind of emergency). All five of us were accommodated in no time and at fare rates. This was for us the best hotel that we had for his price. Many thanks to Murat, Talat and all the other people.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful birthday present”
Reviews.Author: angelachristopher
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband to spend my 6oth birthday in Istanbul. I absolutely loved the city and the hotel surpassed all my expectations. Our room was like the one in the pictures - spacious and comfortable. The breakfasts were good and set us up for the day. The rooms were cleaned daily and the food in the restaurant was great with very friendly service. When we ate there we were given a good discount with free turkish tea. This hotel is very convenient for Topkapi, St Sophia etc and also for trams to other parts of the city, and the Bosphorus boats. We would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Youthful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Thelma-ja-Louise
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness: Rooms were cleaned well, but dirt under the beds. Location: Near old town attractions, too pushing innkeepers next door. Rooms: Small. Unperfected renovation. Air condition was more ventilation and lacked chilling properties. Service: Good and polite. Special thanks to waiter at the breakfast. Thanks to Bodyguard and smiley bartender. Value: Good. Sleep quality: Noise from the street might disturb.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best place to stay in Istanbul... and greatly improved”
Reviews.Author: Darkskymoon
Reviews.Content: I have been at this hotel quite a few times before but I was very positively surprised when I got here this time. This was already a very good hotel, with good service, very friendly staff, clean and with the most perfect location you can find in Istanbul. Now it got even better. To my surprise, they have completely remodeled everything. It was not just a simple paint job and carpet dusting, it was a deep intervention completely changing the looks of the rooms. The old shower that would wet everything in the bathroom is gone. Now there are proper cabins, the water runs strongly and gets warm in 10 seconds, the walls are tiled in nice, lively colors. The new TV on the wall will allow some hundreds of different channels, the central heating and air conditioning devices are brand new and the furniture is classy and comfortable. I guess a great investment was made because this is a radical change and it certainly deserves a return. I'm glad that one of my favorite places to stay in istanbul that I already considered very good, suddenly became fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A really good, good value hotel - great friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rerab
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Istanbul and am really pleased that by good luck (via tripadvisor) to have booked this hotel. All done easily by email in English, they are efficient - they arranged transfer from the airport which was there waiting for us - the place is clean and comfortable; free internet access for guests too. As for location, it s about halfway between the ferries and Aya Sofia/Topkapi - at most about 5-10 minutes walk away - so you couldnt get much closer. Next time I m in Istanbul I ll go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: zakia008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a great location; it is very close to all the top sights you would wish to see in Istanbul and public transport is easily accessible. It is located in a vibrant part of the old city and is ideal for young travellers. The hotel has recently been renovated and is comfortable, with good double glazing which keeps out most of the noise from the streets. The staff were very nice and helpful; special thanks to Murat.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere and good fun”
Reviews.Author: bug42
Reviews.Content: The friendly and relaxed atmosphere made the hotel perfect for our stay during the easter holiday. The staff were always polite and very open, making it easy to make our wishes understood. While it feels like their first project, the unabated enthusiasm for all the details and the number of staff that are always about means there is always someone to ask for advice about places to go. The breakfast was good, varied from day to day. The attached restaurant also had seating spots outside, making it a wonderful place to relax and drink a beer in the afternoon sunshine after a day of sightseeing. The location of 5 minutes walk from Hagia Sophia, the spice market and the harbour, means that you don't run out of things to see in the first couple of days. A couple of finishing touches, e.g. the toilet is a little wobbly, and there is no rubbish bin in the room and we would have rated it Excellent+ :) but definitely worth coming back to!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: noob41
Reviews.Content: Great hotel fantastic location, within a few minutes walk from the blue mosque, the basilica and the aya sofia. Nice clean rooms good value. The hotel manger and staff are really friendly and welcoming and very professional to say the least.They more than made my visit to istanbul an amazing experience. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, the food from the hotel restaurant was easily among the best that i ate during my visit. At night the street on which this hotel is located really comes to life and is so atmospheric! I spent many a night hanging out sitting on the cushions soaking it all in! Thank you so much to the hotel manager Talat and all the staff. Simon from London

Reviews.Title: “Great location,decent place”
Reviews.Author: Drgandalf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 days, thoroughly enjoyed it. Without doubt its best feature is the location. Right next to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia, less than a 5 min walk!!! The rooms were clean and good value. Staff were nice, my only bad thing was they did come across at times a little sleazy on occasion. This I admit maybe more due to the male turkish way, but still seemed a little out of place. Having said that We both still really enjoyed the place and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks a lot!)”
Reviews.Author: OYKC
Reviews.Content: Me and a big group of my friends were staying in this hotel at the beginning of dec 2009. Good clean rooms, very friendly personal, free wi fi, quiet area. All sightseeings are in few minutes walk. I want to give individual thanks to front office director Talat Akdogan for transfer of our group to airport. And thanks for your patience))) we were a little bit noisy))) Best regards, CSKA Moscow fans

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel, Cheap, Clean, Very Small Bathroom, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HLOF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife for 10 days and we both didn't have any major complains. If we could afford a better hotel or was work was paying I wouldn't stay here but as for budget hotel its great. The Rooms are clean, small size but overall definitely okay. The location makes this hotel really great its about 2 minutes from Tram which opens up the city to you. Late night there are tons of taxis to get back to the hotel. Note on the highest floor (5th) there is no WIFI. We were disappointed about that initially but its not a big deal. We just went downstairs to the cafe or computers. Yes the bathroom are small and take sometime to get used it. Besides that there no major complains. Other things the hotel staff is not professional but its part of the price.. As other people said the complimentary breakfast sucks thats not completely true. The breakfast is more european style and its free so you can't complain about it. There are tons of food place nearby so u can go there for breakfast. People stop complaining free things..geehs... I love Istanbul and this hotel made my trip awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Friendly Staff and Safe!”
Reviews.Author: neshe
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to Istanbul and I selected this hotel once again, not only for its cost effectiveness, but also because it offers an abundance of facilities. The hotel is within walking distance to all the major attractions for example, 5-10 minute walk to Sultan Ahmet Mosque/grand bazar. The hotel has a great restaurant where I often relaxed after a long day touring; the menu offered a sufficient range of dishes and the service was excellent. There is also great friendly atmosphere outside should you wish to socialise and meet new people in a safe manner. The staff are attentive, organised and professional. I am a young woman and I was travelling alone; I felt totally safe during my stay and the staff appropriately guided me if I needed any additional assistance. The rooms were clean, spacious and with appropriate temperature. The bathroom and toilet were clean and well maintained. I had ample space in my room and was given a double bed despite being alone. Front desk staff spoke fluent English and their local knowledge was of high standard being in a position to offer good advice when needed. I would like to express my sincer thanks to Talat, Eyup and Okan who were particularly helpful duirng my stay here and made me feel like a part of a family. The manager was also very approachable and I felt that I was well looked after. A fabulous choice; I would have no hesitations in booking this hotel again for my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Heart Warm staffs”
Reviews.Author: nature68
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the staff at the Agan Hotel. We are a group of 15 seniors from San Francisco, CA who stayed at the hotel Agan on 10-30-09 after we disembarked from our cruise ship. We have a marvelous experience during our stay at the Agan hotel. The staffs are so kind and friendly, they went extra miles for us. We have a early flight to catch. On the morning of 10-31 the staff were up early in that morning. Morning call at 5AM, breakfast was ready at 6AM. The warm bread and hot coffee and tea were ready for us. How thoughtful they are! They are all wonderful hosts. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant on the night of 10-30. Every dish we ordered was cooked to perfection, the lamb chop so tender, fishes were so fresh, and salad so green and colorful. Fruits so sweet, and super reasonable price for the meal. We still talked about the delicious meals they prepared for us. The staff made us felt so welcoming. They help to make our visiting to Istanbul a wonderful experience. We sure will recommend the hotel to all our friends who plan to visit Istanbul, and we sure will stay with Hotel Agan again, because it feels like visiting old friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: FrankieBrighton
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 9 friends and family aged between 24 and 64 and just returned from 4 days in Istanbul at Hotel Agan. The staff were very helpful in particular the guy on the desk who helped us out with our trip to Florence Nightingale Museum and also Ayca who was extremely helpful before our visit. It is a relaxed quite jolly no-frills hotel. There is a good restaurant with nice cushions outside to sit sip smoke and relax. Only slight niggles were the small room and loud video music at breakfast time when we were feeling fragile. We visit Istanbul 2/3 times a year and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good laughter”
Reviews.Author: oksat
Reviews.Content: Funny place, relaxed!! Good service and perfect location between the old city and modern, easy to go by taxi or by feet.. Specially thanks to Talat and Okan! We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Jitka and Katarina”
Reviews.Author: Levissima
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great location, helpfull reception, excelent food in restaurant. Everybody was kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: FloatingStar
Reviews.Content: The service from all hotel and restaurant staff was very friendly and helpful. They really made our holiday special. The rooms were clean and tidy with the basic facilities you'd expect. The location was fab! It was close to all the popular sites like the Blue Mosque, Spice Bazaar, Grand Bazaar, the palace and Sultanahmet etc. They are all within walking distance of the hotel (5-10mins). The tram line and station are also only minutes away. The strip that the hotel is on also has a number of other hotels and reastuarants so we were spoilt for choice when it came to dinning out. Every night was entertaining and we enjoyed being in the middle of all the hustle which truly made our evenings special. The staff at the restaurant were always so friendly and hospitable. Food was great too. I would deffienetly recomend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul, is is by far one of the best locations you could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in excellent location for visiting city.”
Reviews.Author: StourbridgeNettyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very pleasant and good value for money, although it was having repairs done in the reception area during our stay. Rooms were attractive, comfortable and clean though rather small. Breakfast was not fantastic though as the coffee was like dish water!! Overall: very good value for money and an excellent base for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeneC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice, the rooms are cleaned, the staff is kind, the position is closed to every thing, breakfast is good and also the restaurant...and it's cheap too!!! Really a nice experience spend a night on the cushions along the narrow street smoking or drinking something! :)

Reviews.Title: “it was a great time there!”
Reviews.Author: cherrysmiling
Reviews.Content: it was a nice cozy hotel, I had a lot to me meaning the works were too polite. 9 days have very much enjoyed my hotel. we went to sleep just yet, outside or right next to each in the bar! if I was going to turkey again, I'll go back to the Hotel Agan, for they are trustworthy people. Hotel Agan thanks for everything! it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Single ladies avoid!”
Reviews.Author: annaleiseandsiobhan
Reviews.Content: Trashy, trashy, trashy. Avoid this dump if you can. You do get what you pay for and no wonder it was so cheap. Rooms are too small and dated. The bath is also very small and gets totally soaked when you shower since there is not a separation between the shower and toilet. The restaurant serves mediocre food and the 10% you get off as a hotel guest really isnâ€™t worth it. Service is slow and yes they could do away with the unprofessional horny front desk staff and waiters who try to pick up dates with single female guests. The waiters get behind on the orders because they are too busy chatting up women. Believe me they will not leave you alone. Itâ€™s like a bad comedy skit. My girlfriend and I were chatted up so much and it kind of spoiled the visit. These chaps just donâ€™t give up and don't care if you have a boyfriend already. Makes you wonder if management knows about this and if so do they care? Almost ruined the whole trip The trip to the city was very nice and I would recommend it to anyone. So much to see and do and we really loved it but too bad this hotel and its staff were the disappointment. I would not recommend this place to a single woman or women traveling together. Next time we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul in one picture”
Reviews.Author: iszilvio
Reviews.Content: The Hotel lays in a charming little street that shows the atmosphere of Istanbul in one breath. If you are lucky to arrive here you don't need time to assimilate. Just sit or lay down on the pillows, order a coffee or tea with a waterpipe... After that you may count the smiles you get but you will give it up soon. All the staff are so kind and friendly as you would have known them for ages. There were maybe 5 hotels and restaurants around so by the time we arrived back from a long day, all of the waiters and hotel staff were fighting each other to get our attention... In a week we had to try everyone's food, coffee and tea as they all wanted to show their quality of hospitality. And I can say we all are pleased. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are tiny, the street is a bit noisy, but we just couldn't care less... All together to staying in Hotel Agan was one of the best experience of all my journeys. Thank you guys and I hope and wish seeing you very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, unforgettable, brilliant”
Reviews.Author: ZsofiBak
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the city, in the heart of TALAT AGDOGEN, the front office director and all of his staff. We'll never forget their hospitality, their commitment to all of their guests. You feel like you are the only one for them, you feel important, valuable, admirable, beautiful and young even you aren't or you are. You feel like going home every evening to this hotel, and there are always people waiting for you to come home. Must go back some times. Zsofi, Hungary, Budapest

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Visitor Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Warhany
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel staff, despite of conditions given by hotel rank, they are trying to do their best, as somebody wrote in other comments, yeah, bathrooms are fun, but rooms always nicely clean. As frequent traveller to Istanbul, I never had visited better hotel there for similar rate.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, friendly and central”
Reviews.Author: JenCapeTown
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Agan for six weeks. As a first-time traveller to Turkey/Istanbul and not speaking the language I was amazed at how helpful the staff were. They were very friendly and knowledgeable and I made good friends with them. Nothing was too much trouble and they assisted me with every aspect of my stay.. The hotel is centrally located with easy access to all major travelling routes/tourist attractions. I found the rates very affordable. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The breakfast was always good quality with more than enough to choose from and plenty to eat. The free interneet was a wonderful bonus. I will definitely stay at Hotel Agan again when I visit Istanbul again. It is my other "home".

Reviews.Title: “Gigolos waiting to attack?”
Reviews.Author: qtcaliforniagirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ok. Good location and clean But just be aware of the two male receptionists...People wrote in previous reviews that the stuff is friendly. The truth is, they are like "male dogs in heat" ! I went with my friend and they were after us non-stop! Are all Turkish men like this? If not, does the General Manager know this? It is not professional and you feel like you are a piece of meat! Not nice at all. Apart from that, the hotel is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Poor facilities and generally in a poor state”
Reviews.Author: fw190a8
Reviews.Content: There are two things that you should know before reading any further: firstly, although the rooms are en-suite, the bathroom is a wet room and the shower is just mounted on the wall so the water goes everywhere, all over the toilet, sink and the hairdryer. Secondly, the hotel's website paints a glossy professional picture that is really some way from the reality. The biggest complaint is, without doubt, the bathroom, which was tiny and there was no room to hang towels. It's simply no use to have a bathroom where the shower sprays water all over the room with no receptacle or curtain or anything. This was very inconvenient. The bathroom was also poorly ventilated and had no windows, so there were large patches of damp on the ceiling and it smelled pretty awful. The bathroom door would only stay shut if slammed extremely hard. The receptionist was sympathetic, and said that the hotel was being renovated in January 2010, although whether this will improve the bathrooms or not is unclear. On the plus side, the hotel bar is pretty much the cheapest place to get a drink in the local area, and the staff were all friendly with a good, lively sense of humour. The free wifi was a plus, but the range was extremely poor, so if you ventured more than about 10 metres from the reception area, it stopped working. The room itself was reasonably clean, but a thick layer of dust adorned the radiator and the metal headboard. Although the room was cleaned every day, the towels were not changed every day, which, given that the water from the bathroom got everywhere, was disappointing. Also, the cleaners folded towels that we had hung to dry, preventing them from drying properly. The bed sheets were never changed during our week at the hotel. The room was equipped with some kind of televisual relic of the 1970s with a scabby remote whose buttons were mostly worn off. The only English channel available was BBC World News. Breakfast was included in the cost of the room but we were extremely disappointed by the selection and general standard. Every single plate in the stack was so wet that water would drip off it onto the floor when tilted. There were only two cereals on offer, and bread with a single type of cheese and cold meat, although there was a large range of salad. Sadly the supply runs out quickly and unless you arrive for breakfast reasonably early, all of the popluar things have gone. When we arrived on the first day, we were told that the room was not ready for us, and we were made to walk to a nearby hotel. We tried to arrange for some compensation for this but the hotel was having none of it, and seemed generally uninterested at the inconvenience caused. The general state of the hotel is poor, with horrible-looking cleaning cupboards (some were left open and visible) and a tiny lift that has no interior door, so it would be perfectly possible to get some loose clothing caught between floors while the lift was in motion. I could not recommend this hotel less, and would choose it again only if the last available option was a park bench. The staff were reasonably friendly and helpful, but this could not possibly make up for the extreme disappointment I experienced at having to pay money to stay somewhere like this.

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoned...”
Reviews.Author: Turnip70
Reviews.Content: This Hotel does have a good location for the tourist's Istanbul, but our air con didn't work, the staff were mainly nice, but one guy in particular quoted us inflated prices for tours and when we challenged him against other quotes we had he was angry. We got food poisoning on our last night there from a cold meze platter...don't think hygiene is high on their list of priorities and we also experienced them recyclying food from a previous diners dish to ours - it was cheap but I wouldn't recommend it, certainly don't eat in their restaurant despite the 10% discount.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PRICE/QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: hanna222
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in this hotel. the staff was really helpfull. they are trying their best for you. the rooms are a bit small but really clean.free internet was a bonus. and they have a new bar which has reasonable prices. It was great to relax on the cushions at the outside after a long day. I will be back again...

Reviews.Title: “Only location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: fecostta
Reviews.Content: The location is really nice! Near of everything! Further major atractions it is also near good restaurants, pubs, stores and parks. The staff is very friendly and helpful. But, the bedroom is a tragedy!! It is too small and you do not have enought space for nothing. Big luggages are a big problem there. The bathroom is the worse thing: no shower (only a fawcet of water that gets boiling and freezing in the same time!). Breaksfast is also terrible: only few options (really few) and you have to wake up very early to find all these options... If you go down at 9 am, you will find only vegetables and rest of yesterday's bread. I paid 40 euro per night and I think this is very expensive for only location.... It would be just if was 20 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cAPPIE00
Reviews.Content: Hotel Agan was one of the best hotels i ve been to for many years. Food was perfect it was nice around, great workers, Nice rooms Breakfest was awesome. If i would choose a hotel to stay in it is in Istanbul and it calls Hotel Agan. Great people Nice service. Next year i really hope they have a place for me because i think it will be crowded there. And the price was really amazing never thought it would be this great. Quiet and Awesome. I REALLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a city break”
Reviews.Author: mayday2073
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at Hotel Agan and would stay here on returning to Istanbul. A+ service at check in. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Donâ€™t bring too much into the bathroom when you shower as it will get damp but at least the water comes out hot. The hotel is in an excellent location and within easy walking distance to places like Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, etc. There is a restaurant in the hotel that offers a wide variety of fabulous meals. The restaurant and hotel staff are a wonderful, friendly and warm group especially our favourite waiter Behcet who always had a really good recommendation on what to order. You can also get airport transfer shuttle service when leaving the hotel for 5 Euro to Ataturk Airport. This is a really good deal if you don't want to take the tram or a taxi. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul and wanting a place close to the city. A great place for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: SAK2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife and a two year old daugther for almost a week. The location is very good. All major attractions such as Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazar, Spice Bazar, and port (for ferry ride) are within 10-15 minutes walk. The staff is very freindly, and almost all of them can communicate in English well enough. We took a two-bed room. The room was bit small, but manageable. There was almost daily supply of toilet paper, shampoo, soap etc. Fresh towels were provided every day. The room had a cupboard, a writing table, and a room refrigerator. The air conditioning unit was excellent. Although the TV was there, the only english channel was the BBC World News. All others were Turkish channels. Turkish breakfast was served every morning in the dining area, and included many items such as Turkish buns, bread, sliced water melons, cucumbers, tomatoes, mortadella, butter, jams, etc, with fresh tea, coffee, juices, and milk. There were two computers in the lobby with the Internet service 24/7, and wirless network is also available in the hotel. The only bit negative thing was that as per our reservation agreement, someone from the hotel was expected to receive us at the airport. When we arrived at the ariport, we wiated for about 20 minutes, and then made phone calls to the hotel twice. With our own effort, we were then able to find the person who came to receive us in totally different part of the airport, where no one would expect him. However, that was not the problem due to the hotel, but rather due to the company that operates shuttle bus service. Another embarassing thing was that when the hotel staff would come to make up the room or to fill the fridge with drinks, they would not bother to knock the door and would open the door with their master key, without any care if someone is inside or not. As a whole, the hotel and the staff were very nice and cooperative. If I go to Istanbul again, I will stay in the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine!”
Reviews.Author: marcouk76
Reviews.Content: Yes, it ain't the Hilton, but then again, you pay â‚¬30 a night so you can't expect 5*! The hotel is just fine. Right in the centre of the old city Sultanahmet, within walking distance of all the major sights and the tram stop is a 3 minutes walk. Taksim can be reached by tram or by taxi (approximately â‚¬6) for the nightlife and restaurants. The hotel itself is more than adequate, staff is helpful albeit a bit grumpy at times. I asked for a single room and was given a twin! It had all I could have asked for and more: air con, toilet and shower, mini-bar, tv, wireless internet connection, towels, soap, slippers, etc. Yes, it wouldn't pass the white glove test, but the mattress was brand new and very comfy. Noise wasn't a problem as the street downstairs is pedestrian and the window was doing a good job at insulating. On checking out I was a bit concerned as my airport transfer was running late: the very kind receptionist offered to call the company with his mobile phone and reassured me the transfer was on its way! Please note the company had nothing to do with the hotel as I had booked it on the Internet prior to my trip. This has to be good service!!! Breakfast was a bit rubbish, the dining room is quite grim and uninviting, but the whole stay for me was great and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A cool place to stay if you are alone”
Reviews.Author: nattygirl
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel to stay if you are on a budget and just want something close to most of the tourist attractions. The rooms are a bit small but itâ€™s fine if you are travelling alone. My only dislike with the room was probably the fact that the bathroom gets drenched with water when you shower. There is nothing that separates the shower area from the toilet. The beds are comfy and the rooms have really good air conditioning. Not much to the television unless you are really good with Turkish. I don't recall International CNN. In the lobby there are free computers just in case you need to keep touch back home or other things. Breakfast is quite different but I am a Westerner; itâ€™s more like a lunch as opposed to the typical sausage and toast the rest of us are used to but of course I did not expect ham or bacon. Itâ€™s okay if you want a quick bite to eat and not expecting much. The staff are wonderful. Fast, easy check in with friendly customer service. The restaurant has a great menu on offer if you donâ€™t care to go elsewhere. In the evenings it's great to sit outside and chill out from a long hot day of walking around. Order some drinks and great food. The waiters are fabulous. Overall I had a very exciting stay at Hotel Agan and would stay here in the future and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good stay at hotel agan”
Reviews.Author: TOtraveller01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Agan from June 5th to June 7th 2009. Overall, we had no real complaints about the hotel. Yes, the rooms were small - but we weren't in Istanbul to stay in our room! The hotel had friendly and helpful staff, free internet in the lobby, and a fantastic location as a base for exploring Istanbul. The one negative aspect was the breakfast. It was served in a dingy basement, and the food was mediocre at best and not really refilled on a regular basis. Other than that, I would say that this is a great place to stay. We also had a great time out on the street having drinks on the huge pillows, and didn't hear the noise from our room at all. Would consider returing to the Agan if we are in Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Bima
Reviews.Content: The Agan is no-frills, but it's perfectly located for Sultanahmet,,Sirkeci, Eminonu, and the ferries. Rooms are very small, and the bathrooms smaller yet, but they're acceptable. The plumbing makes noises like a squealing steam engine. The beds are OK, and it's clean and well-managed. Unfortunately, it's status as a good place to stay is ruined by noisy subway-station construction a block away, and an even louder bunch of narghile (water pipe) and booze lounges that fill the alley right outside your window with loud music, loud laughter, and loud talk until 4AM. If you're down there being a part of it, it's a short stagger to bed, but if you want to sleep, forget it. There are many better options in the Agan's price range (try the Adora).

Reviews.Title: “Our only negative experience in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: hnic17
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 5 month-old son, and I spent two weeks travelling around Turkey. Hotel Agan was our only decidedly negative experience. Initially, it seemed like a nice enough place. The woman who checked us into our room was very friendly and the location was fabulous (as long as you don't mind the very persistent touts in front of every restaurant on the street). First negative experience: we attempted to shower. Many of the hotels and pensions we stayed in had small bathrooms with open showers (not enclosed). We were used to that. We'd been in Turkey for two weeks. This, however, was by far the most awkward set up. The shower was sandwiched so tightly between the wall and the toilet that a large person might actually have to wash with one foot in the john. On top of that, the shower head wouldn't stay fastened in place on the wall, meaning that you have to use one arm to hold the nozzle up while you shower. My husband recommends sitting on the toilet and pouring water over your head. Be careful, though, as the water temperature fluctuates rapidly between scalding hot and ice cold. Our baby had to settle for a sponge bath. Negative experience number two: we were sitting in our room, when we heard a jingling in the lock and the door flew open. Apparently the man who restocks the mini bar (ours did not need restocking) was never informed that it is appropriate to knock before entering other people's hotel rooms. Oh well, that was actually sort of humorous and nothing to get all worked up about. On the other hand . . . Negative experience number three: Okay, here's where it gets ugly. Hotel Agan was our last stop before heading home, and we spent two nights there. We decided that it would be nice to have our laundry done before packing it back into our suitcases and heading home . . . but only if laundry services were affordable (we are students and saved up for an entire year to make this trip). We asked the woman who checked us in about laundry services and she said that the hotel had an arrangement with an outside company who could do our laundry. She couldn't quote an exact price. I asked another hotel employee, a young man, for a rough estimate of the cost. I said, "Can you give me a general idea of the cost? Is it five lira? Fifty lira." He laughed when I said fifty lira and replied, "No, no, it is very cheap. Maybe three or four lira." We had paid between five and ten lira for one load of laundry in the other hotels we had stayed at (some ironed, some didn't, and we didn't care either way). I was surprised to hear that it might be a little cheaper than that in Istanbul, but I figured that even if he was off by a few lira, it was obviously affordable and we should go ahead and have our laundry done. We did. The hotel came back with the bill. SIXTY-FIVE LIRA. That's well over forty U.S. dollars for one load of laundry. We tried expressing polite surprise and dismay. We recounted our earlier conversation with the hotel employee (and were more or less accused of lying). We explained that we'd never paid more than ten lira anywhere else (again, we were accused of lying). The two men we spoke to were discourteous, condescending, and -- I feel -- dishonest. In the end they agreed to let us pay "just" fifty lira, which is still an outrageous price by any standards. I take honesty seriously and go out of my way to treat everyone with kindness and respect. It is very rare that I run into people so unwilling to reciprocate. I would never in any circumstances return to Hotel Agan and I strongly encourage other travelers to support businesses that show basic decency and integrity. If my family's experiences are any indication, Hotel Agan is not that kind of business. I'd recommend staying at the Tash Konak (in Sultanahmet) instead. We spent two nights there, as well, and loved it. We would have returned to the Tash Konak if they hadn't been booked up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bash-N
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are looking for a somewhere just to put your head down to rest.I say this as the room we stayed in was very small -5th floor but was immaculately clean and neat .The hotel is located within walking distant of all the major attractions of istanbul-Blue Mosque,Sophia hagia,Grand Plaza,Topkapi palace.The staff are very friendly and the resturant has excellent food although breakfast was average .The tram stop -Eminonu is within walking distance should you wish to go over to the Asian side. Some tips for travellers arriving at Sabiha Gokcen.Instead of using the hotel transfer which is expensive you can get the E10 bus from outside the airport to Kadikoy.It costs 3 lira.Its a fairly long journey -about 40-60 minutes but at least you get a sightseeing trip for next to nothing.At Kadikoy walk to the left towards the ferries.Take the ferry to Eminonu.This again is really cheap 1.40 lira! The journey is 15-20 minutes- an amazing journey well worth the money At Eminonu exit to your left - crossing the overhead bridge and then to your left again and up Ankara Street.Ebussuud cad is the 2nd or 3rd turn and you at the hotel.So for a 4.40 lira you get a scenic journey to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money and central”
Reviews.Author: norwaytravel33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place for 4 nights and we loved it. The rooms are small but very clean, and yes the bathroom is realy small but it is working. It is close to the Spice markedet and Haga Sophia and other things. And the staff is very very helpfull. We had dinner 2 nights at the hotel and it was great. A bit off noice if you live on the 1 level but we had ear pluggs and it work out great, this place is realy good value for money. We used there pick up service and it was realy nice, on the way from the airport we got a small tour off the city and it was nice and the driver waitet even if we arrived late. On the way back to the airport the driver car stopet working but in around 10 minuts he had made som calls and we where on oure way. Also we tried the bath toure and it was great as well, the pick you up and deliver you to back once you are done. We are already planing to stay her again, this is a nice place even if the room are small but hey you just sleep there anyway. They have breakfast but we never tried that, we did go to the place 10 meters down the street and had a great breakfast and realy cheep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: keenon
Reviews.Content: My BF and I stayed in the hotel for three nights from 25 to 28 April 09. The location could not be better. Easy access on foot to absolutely all the main sites in the old Istanbul. They also have a restaurant but the service was very very slow. We only had drinks and it took over 20 minutes to arrive. We definitely decided to go for dinner somewhere else. The pick up service they organize from the airport was efficient but expensive (25 euros). There was another couple on our flight staying at the hotel and we shared the cost. They can also book you on the shuttle that takes you to the airport for 5 euros. The staff is very kind and they go out of their way to help you. We used the safety box in the reception, free of charge and the wifi internet connection is free also but a bit slow. There are also computers to roam the internet for free in the reception. The room we stayed was really really small but clean. The bathroom was even smaller. Everything got wet when we had a shower. Breakfast was not great but had all you need to start the day, bread, tomatoes, boiled eggs, olives, cheese (2 types) and a kin of ham we did not dare to touch. Anyway, we forgot a bag with camcorder, camera and binoculars in the room when we left really early in the morning to the airport. We had no problem in getting it back. We really recommend the hotel, make up your mind about the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best price for good conditions”
Reviews.Author: corinaZ
Reviews.Content: Reading other reviews I had some fears...but no, it was mostly ok. Very easy to reach from the airport (sub+tram), situated in the centre of historical Istanbul, it allows you to visit everything in the area without other help then your own feet. The single room at the first floor was very small, but for the money paid, more than enough. Cleaning was done every day, the same with changing towels or bringing bath products.Wi-fi is indeed available in the room and works ok and morning breakfast, without being very diverse, is more than sufficient. Yes, the bath is liliputan...but in one or two days I got used to its dimensions. The staff speaks enough English in order to help you. Pros: the position; the cleanness of the room, the price Cons: a little noisy ...but the noise was done by other tourists, who perhaps forget common sense when travelling abroad (especially from Northern Europe. I donâ€™t really understand whatâ€™s happening; it is not my first bad experience with them)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Matilda534
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean whit excellent services. A perfect place to visit Istanbul. The staff was friendly, especially Talat Akdogan was so helpful arranging us everything. I would definitely recommend the hotel ! Lucia (France)

Reviews.Title: “Great, Central, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LOLBrighton
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a lovely 3 night city break at this hotel. The location is perfect to be able to explore on foot this wonderful city. We booked our transfers from the Asian side online (Istanbul airport shuttle) 10 euros pp and they were brilliant, on time and helpful for the journey both ways. The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming so we felt at home straight away. Our room was clean and cosy as in the pictures, which is all we needed at such a good price. The room was cleaned and the laundry changed daily and the Turkish breakfast was more than enough to start the day. I loved sitting outside the bar area in the evenings on cushions snuggled under a blanket (if needed) watching the world go by. The staff all work so hard and nothing was too much trouble. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: SurreyDoris
Reviews.Content: Two girl friends and me decided we wanted to visit Istanbul. We wanted a fairly cheap break, central hotel and Agan fitted the bill. Before we went I emailed the hotel enquiring whether they could arrange a transfer from the airport (Asia side). I had an instant reply and a transfer was arranged. The staff on reception and in the bar were very friendly and helpful. Our room was very small, 4 single beds in, the bathroom also tiny with a shower on the wall but didn't stay upright so had to hold it, no shower tray but it served its purpose. I would definitely recommend the hotel. There's plenty to do and see in Istanbul, not the easiest place to get around on public transport but everyone is happy to help. Females, get used to unwanted attention! The North Shield pub by the Agan is worth a visit, showing all sport, keep an eye on the bar tab though, it soon amounts up!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: JookyEdiburgh
Reviews.Content: I am used to larger hotels so got a bit of a shock! the Faulty towers of Istanbul.. It was clean, great beds,clean towels and shampoos etc every day.Wet room needs an update but hey, this is a budget hotel. Breakfast was good,staff friendly and free interent access in lobby.it is a superb location for all the tourist attractions, get the tram if you get tired of the hills and you must go to the parks there, wonderfully kept and clean.no grafiitti! Food is good, we found some good cafes for coffee and cakes and reasonalby priced food for evening.Istanbul is well worth a visit, but beware, they want to haggle in the markets, go to half and then see where it goes from there, it is very tiring but great fun.as for Hotel, I would go back there, its friendly and has a safe atmosphere albeit a little topsy turvy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor toilet/ shower”
Reviews.Author: LJ1231
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the major sites (Blue Mosque, Topkapi). Rooms are a/c and they turned it on even in April, which was nice. The toilet was the main disappointment. While it was clean, drainage was really poor, and the whole toilet was wet (and stayed wet) after a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Buget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaystant21
Reviews.Content: HavÄ±ng read the revÄ±ews we booked 2 sÄ±ngle rooms so we would have more space and the bathrooms would not cause too many problems. New matresses and beddÄ±ng were put Ä±nto the room (so now softer pÄ±llows) durÄ±ng our stay and my room was very clean and fresh towels everyday. NÄ±ce touch shampoo and soap haÄ±rdryer Ä±n bathroom and TV although control dÄ±d not work I could change on the T.V. The breakfast was good wÄ±th a choÄ±ce of tea and coffee cereal and typÄ±cal turkÄ±sh or contÄ±nental better than some prÄ±cer hotels Ived stayed at. There Ä±s a problem wÄ±th EnglÄ±sh beÄ±ng spoken ! In that we expect everyone to speak Ä±t we should try to comunÄ±cate Ä±n TurkÄ±sh use a Phrase book Ä±ts part of the fun.
